column1:
0927|9:27 A.M.|9:27 A.M.
Vance leaned back against the scrub cypress and listened to the whistle of the light wind through the granite outcroppings. He had perched himself on one of the rugged cliffs
column2: from which he could see virtually everything that went on aboveground. Around him ants crawled
column3: oblivious to the heat of the sun
column4: which now seared the bone-colored rocks on all sides
column5: while down below the languorous surf beckoned.

column1: 0927|twenty-seven minutes past nine|From twenty minutes past nine until twenty-seven minutes past nine
column2: from twenty-five minutes past eleven until twenty-eight minutes past eleven
column3: from ten minutes to three until two minutes to three the heroes of the school met in a large familiarity whose Olympian laughter awed the fearful small boy that flitted uneasily past and chilled the slouching senior that rashly paused to examine the notices in assertion of an unearned right.
